means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 利奇 Leach的变体

word_mean: 水蛭、蛭、蚂蟥：蛭纲(Hirudinea)的任何环节动物，特别是医用水蛭(Hirudo medicinalis)。有些种，可暂时寄生于动物和人。水蛭曾广泛用于吸取血液。另见hirudin和leeching

lj.lj_ly: he's been hanging around Caroline like a leech.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English lǣce, lȳce; related to Middle Dutch lake, lieke
Old English lǣce, of Germanic origin
late 15th cent.: probably of Scandinavian origin and related to Swedish lik, Danish lig, denoting a rope sewn round the edge of a sail to stop the canvas tearing

encyclopedia.content: leech，水蛭的英文学名。蛭纲环节动物的统称，约300种。一般来说，水蛭前端有较小的口吸盘，后端有较大的后吸盘。体长不一，有的极小，有的长约20厘米。主要见于淡水或陆地。有的捕食其他动物，有的以有机物碎屑为食，也有寄生者。水蛭吸食鱼、两栖类、鸟和哺乳类的血液，或取食螺类、昆虫幼虫和蠕虫。真正的陆蛭则只吸哺乳类血液。唾液中含麻醉伤口、扩张血管和抗凝血的物质。有的种类被医生用作替病人放血已有几个世纪。由欧洲医蛭提取的水蛭素已在医学上作为抗凝血剂。

entry.def: A leech is a small animal which looks like a worm and lives in water. Leeches feed by attaching themselves to other animals and sucking their blood.
If you describe someone as a leech, you disapprove of them because they deliberately depend on other people, often making money out of them.

example.ex: They're just a bunch of leeches cadging off others!
example.tran: 他们只不过是一帮伸手向人要这要那的寄生虫！

means.word_mean: 1. carnivorous or bloodsucking aquatic or terrestrial worms typically having a sucker at each end
2. a follower who hangs around a host (without benefit to the host) in hope of gain or advantage

sentences.sentence: "In the old days, doctors routinely bled patients as part of the treatment"
